explains: n. 有权得到的东西，应得的数额；权力；权利感，特权感；政府津贴

sentences.en: This may affect your entitlement to compensation.
sentences.cn: 这可能影响你索赔的权利。

sentences.en: They lose their entitlement to welfare when they start work.
sentences.cn: 他们开始工作时就丧失了享受福利的权利。

sentences.en: Instead, the claimant receives a time-limited "allowance", conditional on actively seeking a job; no entitlement and no insurance, at 71 pounds a week.
sentences.cn: 相取而代之的是，申请人在积极寻找工作的前提下才会得到一份有时限的“津贴”；他们一周也得不到71英镑的救济金和保险。
